Authors:
Micael Ferreira Gonçalves, Liliana Santos, Bruno Silva,
Alberto Abreu, Tânia Vicente, Ana Esteves, Artur Alves
Title:
Biodiversity of Penicillium species from marine environments
in Portugal and description of Penicillium lusitanum sp. nov., a novel
species isolated from sea water
Journal:
International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary
Microbiology
Abstract:
During an extensive survey of marine fungi in coastal
marine environments from Portugal, several Penicillium strains were
isolated from sea water, macroalgae and driftwood. The most common and
abundant species that appeared regularly on the Portuguese coast were P.
terrigenum and P. brevicompactum. Phylogenetic analysis based on ITS and
partial b-tubulin genes placed one isolate into Penicillium section
Ramosa, distinct from all currently known species and closely related to
P. tunisiense. Penicillium lusitanicus sp. nov. are proposed here as
novel species and we provide detailed descriptions of the morphological
characteristics.
